[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures may impede smooth reading for some readers.

[TRANSITION]: Anecdotes (e.g., Colonial squatter, *Mark Rutherford*) feel loosely connected to preceding ideas.

[LEXICON]: Archaic vocabulary (e.g., "gay world," "sinewy English style") may hinder readability for modern readers.
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally convoluted sentence structures (e.g., multiple nested clauses).

[TRANSITION]: Slight abruptness between paragraphs (e.g., shift from critic’s role to bookman’s collection).
[STRUCTURE]: Tangential examples (e.g., specific book editions) slightly disrupt thematic flow.
